node.text: Gina Chersevani (@mixtressdc) runs one of the coolest spots around, @BuffaloBergenDC, where you’ll find everything from fountain drinks to cocktails, all served alongside bagels, knishes, latkes, and more. Pull up a virtual seat at their bar, and if you’re in DC, be sure to swing by and check out their offerings. 📹 @buckbaymedia

node.title: Throwing it back to one of our 2019 #Imbibe75 People to Watch.

node.text: @ShihoFukada filmed this beautiful video about shochu’s history and culture, how it’s made, and how to use it in cocktails—it will instantly transport you to Japan and inspire you to try shochu yourself. And to learn more about Japanese shochu, be sure to follow @jss_shochu. #shochu #shochucocktail #jss_shochu #partnerpost #imbibe #imbibegram

node.title: The story of Japanese shochu is rich and layered.

node.text: Brewing a batch of Chemex coffee every morning is one of our favorite daily rituals. The classic brewer is a cinch to use, but there are a few little tricks to getting it just right, so our friends @AllegroCoffee put together a helpful how-to. Check it out before you brew your next batch! #chemex #coffeebrewing #coffeefliicks #imbibe #imbibegram

node.text: Lately, we’ve been daydreaming about traveling to Charleston and taking a seat at #TheLivingRoom bar @TheDewberryCharleston, helmed by @prettyprettyryancasey. Join us on a virtual trip to one of our favorite cities and bars. #charlestonsc #charlestonlife #hotelbar #imbibe #imbibegram 📹 @buckbaymedia

node.title: What bars and cities do you miss visiting these days?

node.text: Figuring out the right grind for your favorite brewing methods is key, so our friends @allegrocoffee put together this handy video to break it all down. #coffeefliicks #coffeeathome #coffeegrinder #imbibe #imbibegram

node.title: Have you dialed in your daily coffee grind?

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Imbibe on September 15, 2021 tagging @cinzano.official. May be an image of drink and text.

node.text:
3 ingredients that are sure to make for a perfect day 3 of #NegroniWeek:
💫
1oz gin
1 oz. Campari
1 oz. @Cinzano.Official 1757 Vermouth di Torino Rosso

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Imbibe on September 15, 2021 tagging @nicoscarnera. May be an image of 1 person and drink.

node.text: The Sbagliato (meaning “mistaken”) was purportedly invented in the 1970s when Milanese bar owner Mirko Stocchetto somehow mistook a bottle of sparkling wine for gin while preparing a Negroni at Bar Basso. Around half a century later, the riff is still a superstar. “It’s remained popular, in my opinion, because it speaks of an era in which it was possible to do a lot with little,” says @NicoScarnera, an Italy-based Campari Academy bartender. The Sbagliato showed bartenders “the perfect ingredients to create a twist on a classic that could become famous: simplicity of the recipe, ease in finding the ingredients all around the world, name that is easy to remember (and pronounce),” Scarnera says. Head to the link in our profile to read more about the Sbagliato and to check out the recipe. 📸 @johnvalls_f2.0

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Imbibe on September 15, 2021 tagging @southernsmoketx. May be an image of ‎text that says '‎TAKING OUR OUR رጥ CARE OF OWN‎'‎.

node.text: Houston chef Chris Shepherd (@cshepherd13) launched the Southern Smoke Foundation in 2015 after learning that a friend and former sommelier had been diagnosed with multiple sclerosis. With the motto “Taking Care of Our Own,” Southern Smoke has raised hundreds of thousands of dollars for the MS Society, but the organization has quickly expanded over the years to address many crises, including Hurricane Harvey in 2017, the ongoing COVID crisis, and, most recently, Hurricane Ida. Southern Smoke’s Emergency Relief Fund supports the entire food and beverage chain—from farmers and winemakers to dishwashers and servers—in all 50 states, and they provide funds directly to people who are battling health crises, storm damage, natural disasters, mental health needs, and the ongoing pandemic. We're thrilled to have them for the second year as a #NegroniWeek nonprofit partner and thank all of the participating venues that are supporting them this week. Follow them @southernsmoketx and head to southernsmoke.org to learn more about their work and to find how you can either donate or receive assistance.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Imbibe on September 14, 2021 tagging @bolscocktails, and @bolscocktailsusa. May be an image of drink and indoor.

node.text:
One of our favorite Negroni variations to make every #NegroniWeek is the Red Light Negroni, which makes a simple swap in of genever for the base spirit, still sticking with the classic equal-parts formula. 
✨
1 oz. Bols Genever
1 oz. Campari
1 oz. sweet vermouth
✨
Be sure to mix one up for yourself, and stay tuned for more this week about Bols genever, including an awesome giveaway we’ve got coming up with them in celebration of Negroni Week. 🎉

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Imbibe on September 14, 2021 tagging @campariofficial, @robertosimonson, and @campariusa. May be an image of ‎1 person and ‎text that says '‎The "Out of This World" Aperitif መនዳ P C & That's Really IN! ounces Campari A M Americano 1/2 Italian Vermouth much soda Serve very cold. served in Milan Rome. 1/z Campari M צצבם A Twist lemon Cracked ice Serve or without club A R Negroni 1/3 Italian Vermouth 1/ Gin Campari A Shake with als served long drink R with sparkling water. IMPORTED, PREPARED BOTTLED BY AUSTIN, NICHOLS co., INC. NEW YORK- YORK 48 PROOF‎'‎‎.

node.text: “Some years ago, Campari started running ads featuring a recipe for the Negroni in newspapers across the United States,” writes @RobertOSimonson in his latest Imbibe feature. "The tagline went, 'A great American tradition since 1983.’ The ads began in 1973.Campari, of course, was poking fun at itself. The Italian bitters was not popular in America. No one, outside of traditionally Italian enclaves in San Francisco and elsewhere, was drinking Campari. No one was mixing Negronis. Few knew what a Negroni was.” Head to the link in our profile to read more from Robert about how the Negroni’s fortunes changed in America.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Imbibe on September 14, 2021 tagging @mr_diaz, @mata.tu.sed, and @nouswithoutyou. May be an image of 2 people, beard, people standing, indoor and brick wall.

node.text: Day two if #NegroniWeek brings a new episode of #RadioImbibe, and for this one, we check in with Damián Diaz (@mr_diaz) and Othón Nolasco (@mata.tu.sed), cofounders of one of our newest Negroni Week fundraising partners, @NoUsWithoutYou, about their work to support undocumented back-of-house hospitality workers and their families during the pandemic. Then, we head to San Diego for a Tony’s Negroni from Anthony Schmidt (@mr_schmidtters) at J&Tony’s Discount Cured Meats & Negroni Warehouse (@prosciuttoboyz), one of this year’s participating venues. Head to the link in our profile to tune in, or download the episode with your favorite app. 📸 Courtesy of Consortium Holdings and @melhummel

node.text: What’s your favorite variation on the Negroni? Is it a Coffee Negroni? A Kingston Negroni? A Sbagliato? Over at imbibemagazine.com, we’ve rounded up some of our favorites—head to the link in our profile to check them out. 📸 @ericmedsker

node.text: Got your vermouth ready to go for Negroni Week? Grab a bottle of Cinzano 1757 and join the festivities: Take a photo with your best Negroni and share it with us by tagging @cinzano.official and @imbibe with the #NegroniWeek hashtag!

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Imbibe on September 13, 2021 tagging @rootsfund. May be an image of text that says 'THEROOTS FUND'.

node.text: In July 2020, hospitality consultant Ikimi Dubose, master sommelier and Heitz Cellar CEO @CarltonMcCoy Jr., and @TheHueSociety founder Tahiirah Habibi (@sippingsocialite) launched The @RootsFund. The organization works to secure pathways for communities of color into the wine industry, provides far-reaching educational scholarships, mentorship, financial support, and job placement to BIPOC interested in all aspects of wine. As one of our newest Negroni Week nonprofit partners, we recently spoke with Dubose, the organization's executive director, about the specifics of The Roots Fund’s support, why the nonprofit’s work is bigger than wine, and what excites her about the future of the wine industry. Head to the link in our profile to read more.

buttons.text: Visit the COVID-19 Information Center for vaccine resources.

node.text: The best week of the year is here! #NegroniWeek 2021 is officially kicking off, and thousands of bars and restaurants around the world are celebrating and supporting a range of wonderful charitable causes. Want to join the festivities? Head to negroniweek.com to find participating venues in your area and to check out this year’s list of nonprofit partners. When you visit your local participating venues, be sure to adhere to all mask and/or vaccination guidelines as well as local/state guidelines, and, of course, be kind to your servers and tip well. If you plan to mix up Negronis at home, at negroniweek.com you’ll also find lots of recipes and ways to get Negroni fixings delivered to your doorstep from @shakerandspoon, @minibardelivery, @saloonbox, and @kegworks. Be sure to follow the #negroniweek hashtag to check out how people are celebrating around the world, and use the hashtag yourself to share your own adventures while tagging @imbibe, @campariofficial, and @campariusa. We’re so excited to celebrate with you all week long! ❤️🎉❤️

node.text: Are you an Imbibe subscriber? If not, we’ve got a great reason to sign up! Through Negroni Week (which starts tomorrow!), we’re donating $5 of every online subscription order to Negroni Week nonprofit partner @RootsFund, which is dedicated to nourishing and enriching the lives of communities of color in the wine world. Next up is our annual Holiday Issue, so don’t miss out—subscribe via the link in out profile. ❤️❤️ 📸 @johnvalls_f2.0

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Imbibe on September 10, 2021 tagging @cooperscraft. May be an image of drink and indoor.

node.text: Ready to mix some Boulevardiers for Negroni Week? Head to the link in our profile to read about our latest Drink of the Week, @CoopersCraft Barrel Reserve.
